text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the baking tray/sheet either by greasing or lining with baking/parchment paper. Cream the butter and icing sugar in the mixing bowl.  Sift in the flours. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. If you find that the dough is a little too dry, add a little water. Halve the dough.  Sprinkle flour over the work surface. Roll both pieces of dough into two thin rounds. Try to make both even in height and keep the edges tidy. Place both rounds onto the prepared baking tray/sheet. Use a fork to prick all over the dough rounds. Then, use a butter knife to gently mark six triangles. Place in the oven. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until they turn a pale golden colour. Remove from the oven. While still warm, sprinkle with the caster/superfine sugar. Then, cut into the triangles. Transfer to the wire cooling rack to cool. Finished.
